page.title: 15Plantlife-the Girvan Valley
page.content: There is a great diversity of plantlife in the Girvan Valley due to the range of soils and slopes. The dominant plants in the intensively farmed valley floor are grasses although along the roadside verges are also found{stitchworts, red {campion and hogweed}.The giant hogweed can be dangerous when the stem is broken because the sap can cause burning of the skin. East of Old Dailly are important stands of woodland, both deciduous and coniferous, the latter being grown for commercial purposes and being mainly{ {Norwegian Spruce and Japanese Larch. } The deciduous trees on the other hand are mainly ornamental and include{oak, {beech, horse chestnut and many rarer {species.}
